name: Lee Wallard
introduction: Leland "Lee" Wallard (September 7, 1910 - November 29, 1963) was a United States racing driver who won the 1951 Indianapolis 500. In a race that saw only eight cars finish, Wallard led 159 of the 200 laps, despite driving a car that was turned down by Tony Bettenhausen in practice. During the race, the car suffered from overheating brakes and a broken exhaust pipe and shock absorber. Wallard was also the first driver to ever finish the race in less than four hours.
